content.raw:
Since the file is added separately in the pull request, we could include it instead of copying the whole file here. [This](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/src/dea7b9a96b913df0c4c26442303295752278767b/plugins_hello_world/tutorial-6.md?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) tutorial has an example, it would be something like:

`<include from='/<?xml/' src='#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/raw/default/joint_events/tutorial.md' />`
content.html:
Since the file is added separately in the pull request, we could include it instead of copying the whole file here. This tutorial has an example, it would be something like:

<include from='/<?xml/' src='#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/raw/default/joint_events/tutorial.md' />

content.raw: it would also be nice to link to the file so they can download it
content.html: it would also be nice to link to the file so they can download it

I think I made the fix, but the branch viewer is showing cached version, so hard to tell yet if the changes are good.

It looks like the beginning of the include is missing the special symbols:

~~~
xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.5">
   ...
~~~

content.raw: It seems that `<region>` is not a parameter. You can mention that the region is declared using the `<range>` element inside the `<event>` section.

content.raw:
`If you like, you can add a description of the world like this:`

The world contains a single model, "revoluter", which has 2 links:

1. "base", and orange box
1. "needle", a white cylinder

It also contains 2 joints: 

1. "fix", a fixed joints that prevents the "base" link from moving in the world.
1. "my_joint", a revolute joint that allows the needle to rotate around the center of the "base" link

The force, velocity and position of "my_joint" will trigger events.
content.html:
If you like, you can add a description of the world like this:

The world contains a single model, "revoluter", which has 2 links:

  1. "base", and orange box
  2. "needle", a white cylinder

It also contains 2 joints:

  1. "fix", a fixed joints that prevents the "base" link from moving in the world.
  2. "my_joint", a revolute joint that allows the needle to rotate around the center of the "base" link

The force, velocity and position of "my_joint" will trigger events.

content.raw: ok, I managed to see the `joint_velocity` events, there are just many more `joint_angle` events, so it's hard to notice the velocity ones
content.html: ok, I managed to see the joint_velocity events, there are just many more joint_angle events, so it's hard to notice the velocity ones

it's harder to catch especially because joint_angle fills the console / buffer, but it is there if you look very hard (and fast! :-) ) as joint velocity transitions in/out of 3-3.3 rad/s range.

name: "joint_velocity"

    sec: 130
    nsec: 163000000

    nsec: 300000000
  }

  iterations: 130163
}
